title: Handguards - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Install the sleeve to the recess in the front brake master cylinder.
Position the right hand side handguard assembly to the front master cylinder and make sure the holes in the handguard bracket, master cylinder and brake lever are aligned. Fit the pivot bolt.
Fit the flanged sleeve and a new lock nut to the pivot bolt. Make sure the flanged sleeve locates correctly in the handguard bracket. Do not fully tighten at this stage.
Fit the spacer and handlebar end fixing to the handguard end. Do not fully tighten at this stage.

Position the left hand side handguard bracket to the clutch lever bracket and make sure the holes in the handguard bracket, clutch lever bracket and clutch lever are aligned. Fit the clutch lever pivot bolt with a new lock nut. Do not fully tighten at this stage.
Fit the spacer and handlebar end fixing to the handguard end. Do nut fully tighten at this stage.
Right hand side shown, left hand side similar
Position the handguards to allow hand clearance around the brake and clutch levers.
Tighten the left hand handlebar end fixing to
Tighten the clutch lever pivot bolt to
Tighten the clutch lever pivot lock nut to
Tighten the brake lever pivot bolt to
Tighten the brake lever pivot lock nut to
Tighten the right hand side handlebar end fixing to

It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes; you must have your authorised Triumph dealer take remedial action. Failure to take remedial action will reduce braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Check that both the clutch and brake lever operate correctly and are not restricted by the handguards.
Check for correct operation of the brake light.
Riding a motorcycle when there is any doubt as to any aspect of the performance of the throttle operation may result in loss of control of the motorcycle and an accident.
Check the operation of the twist grip and make sure that its operation is not restricted in any way by the handguard.

Move the handlebars to left and right full lock while checking that the handguards do not restrict full lock operation. Check cables or harnesses do not bind or restrict full lock operation. Any component, cables or harnesses that will restrict the steering may cause loss of control of the motorcycle and an accident.
